dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Where...?
T.B.
Welcome to the bus~ And oh, we are—

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: An Odachi...?! Hah!
The Blade Lineage woman sprang from her prone position, grabbing the sword next to her. She held the grip of her blade, ready to draw it at any moment.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Identify yourselves! Are you with the Kurokumo Clan?!
No.
Uh, so, we're—

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Then why does that woman wield an Odachi?!
Tsk. She will not listen. We should kill her.
<Ryōshū!>
She pisses me off for two reasons.
One. She refused to listen, making this conversation longer than it needed to be.
Two. She dared to compare their... scrap metals to my blade.
Is there any reason for me *not* to proceed with her O.O.F, Clock?
<Yeah, there is! She can't tell us anything if she's dead.>
...Tsk.
Ryōshū often shows bursts of emotion in the most unexpected times... but at least she listens when I ask her to. Which is a relief.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: I-I suppose your blade is not exactly like theirs... Your uniform is certainly different.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: And you... who might you be? You certainly wear a rather loud timepiece... Are you unable to communicate otherwise?
They are our manager. Their vocalizations will not reach your ears.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: ... I recognize the scent your voice carries. It's... familiar.
Even in the Districts that I have resided in have I not met fellows who speak as I do...

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Speak as you do, indeed. Yet I sense familiarity in your choice of verbiage.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: You must be from District 19... S Corp., are you?
... Though I have fled, that is where I hail from.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: I see... so you have also left your home behind.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: My compatriots oft share the same fate as we do.
Perhaps meeting someone from the same home District helped; the woman visibly relaxed before slumping down on a nearby chair. Her breathing was labored.
My name is Yi Sang. I have operated on the wounds you have suffered.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Ah... So I have acted with such brutishness despite your kindness—please, accept my apologies.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Call me Aeng-du. I am a Salsu from the Lineage that deals in Blades.
Ooh... Dante, maybe we can leave the talking to Yi Sang this time?
<Mhm, looks like we can sit back and let him handle this.>
I nodded, replying quickly to Rodya's whispers.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: If you are from District 19, S Corp. territory... then you must be aware of who we are.
I am somewhat aware, though I am far from acquainted with tales from the streets.
I have heard that the Blade Lineage is bound to no master, no land; yet whence do you flee?

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: It is a tale far too long to be shared in full. All I may divulge is that we had no choice but to seek a territory for us to thrive in.
Perhaps there is aught that we could do to assist, should you deign to impart us the particulars of your pursuers.
Aeng-du shot a sweeping glance at all of us. Her eyes appeared heavy with crushing exhaustion.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Mm, if you and your fellows were skilled enough to defeat this group of foes... then all of you must be quite capable.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Kurokumo Clan has put a bounty on our heads. Our mentor, my fellows... all of us.
Hold on, this ain't just any other strife, then...? That sounds more personal than your usual turf war.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: ... As it has always been, District 19 is fraught with corruption and disturbance to the lives of the public.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: There is very little that us men and women of the blade, who seek naught else but to train and walk the path of martial arts, can do to change the Wing now known as 'Salpippyeo Agroindustries'... or S Corp.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: As the old saying goes... what other choice does a monk who abhors his temple have but to leave it behind? Thus we have departed from our home.
So the people of S Corp. suffer still.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: We had departed in search of a new home... yet it was no easy journey.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Most territories have already been made home by others; in order for us to settle, conflict was unavoidable.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: In the midst of those conflicts, I have the memory of our mentor bringing us an... 'invitation'. An invitation to enter a 'Library' of sorts.
Vergilius, who had been sitting quietly with one leg over the other on a chair far from the rest of us, visibly reacted.
I think I remember that the word 'Library' always got a genuine reaction out of Vergilius.
You 'have the memory'... Quite an odd way to phrase your own recollections.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Mm. We arrived at the Library, hoping to escape the Kurokumo Clan's clutches...

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: ... but all we had done was to lead ourselves into just another field of battle. We were handily defeated.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Then, all of a sudden, we found ourselves stranded in the Backstreets of T Corp. upon our waking. The bizarreness of such an experience can only be described by an expression just as odd.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: ... Ah! Mentor Bamboo-hatted Kim!
Her eyes suddenly widened mid-sentence. Aeng-du leaped from her seat.

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: I believe that our mentor remains there still...! We must make haste to Yong-jin Building!
Be not so hasty! Such wild movements may tear the wounds that I have—

dataList.title: Blade Lineage
dataList.content: Kagh...
Huhh?! W-what the heck! Is she dead?
It is no surprise that a sudden rise in blood pressure in lieu of blood supply would cause one to faint. She has merely lost her consciousness.
Phew...
You were right, manager. She did have some useful intel for us.
Yong-jin Building... I suppose we have some business there, then.
<Mmm... Maybe, but I'm not sure. I don't know what this has to do with our mission, if any.>
Or maybe it's that 'Library' that we should—
Danger, danger.
Bunch of people in Mephi's way. Swinging swords around. Black clothes.
Passengers, move out. Protect Mephi.
Hm... Executive Manager, they appear to be Kurokumo Clan's reinforcements.
<Well, what can we do...>
We'll have to think about this later. For now, let's take care of the reinforcements.
